body.p: Which of the following best describes a D/A converter?

multiple_choice.choice: It takes in numeric samples and converts them to an analog signal.
It takes in digital error numbers and converts them to alpha values.
It takes in decimal values and converts them to Avagadro values.
It takes in digital IP addresses and converts them to routing numbers.
It takes in an analog signal and converts it to numeric samples.

response.feedback: A D/A converter converts digital numeric samples to analog signal.
D/A input is numeric, but it is not focused on errors specifically.
D/A input is numeric, but the output is not in Avagardo values.
D/A input is numeric, but it does not take in IP addresses to convert to routing numbers.
This is an example of an A/D converter.
